priorVersion.title: CDISC SDTM Death Diagnosis Test Code Terminology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C116108

self.title: CDISC SDTM Death Diagnosis Test Code Terminology

definition: Terminology relevant to the test codes that describe the death diagnosis and related details.
name: SDTM Death Diagnosis and Details Test Code
preferredTerm: CDISC SDTM Death Diagnosis Test Code Terminology
synonyms: SDTM Death Diagnosis and Details Test Code

terms.definition: The age at which death occurred. (NCI)
An indication as to whether an autopsy was performed. (NCI)
An indication as to whether a death certificate was obtained. (NCI)
An indication as to whether the death event was witnessed by another individual.
An indication as to whether a hospital medical record was obtained.
The person or authoritative source that provided the cause of death.
terms.preferredTerm: Information Source for Cause of Death
synonyms: Information Source for Cause of Death

terms.definition: The physical location at which the subject ceased to live.
The primary significant event which ultimately led to death.
An indication as to whether death was unexpected or occurred without warning.
The secondary significant event which ultimately led to death.
